author: wrowe
msg: A patch to clean up much bogusity in Win32.  Eliminates absolute cd "/..."
references using build/fixwin32mak.pl, and the latest #if APR_HAVE_FOO_H
fixes apparently worked, now that they no longer appear as dependencies

author: wrowe
msg: Yuck.  Absolute cd / statements [first I ever noticed them!]  I'll
scratch up some perl code to fix them relative to the build directory.
Why has this never bitten us?  Simple - we don't use the recursive
build mechanism - we actually go through the .mak targets with norecurse.
This commit was manufactured by cvs2svn to create tag

author: wrowe
msg: Refresh all .mak files should we choose to roll again shortly.
